segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, it's remarkable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's polishing it with such dedication, almost meticulously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, the faucet is running unchecked, creating a literal flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her diligence on one small task is overshadowing a major problem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It frustrates me to see such misplaced effort.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring onto the floor, making a huge puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she hear the running water or feel it around her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a bizarre disconnect between her actions and the reality of the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All that water damage will be far more costly than a perfectly polished plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She needs to address the immediate crisis, not the minor detail.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This inefficiency is quite annoying to observe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can only shake my head at the scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a prime example of not seeing the forest for the trees.
segments.speaker: PAR
